titleStmt.title: Description of Maimonides' Commentary on the Mishnah of Seder Nashim, in Judeo-Arabic.

notesStmt.note: A note of sale: folio 1r.Folio 2r: contains a document, partly in a Scriptural language, in which a certain Benyamin ben Avraham of Aden is recommended to the charity of the cities of Yemen. Cf similar documents in Cairo Genizah. Sa᾿alam ibn Moron Al-῾Araki: inscribed, folio 3r. Sa᾿alam ibn Se῾adyah ben Shelomoh Al-Suri: inscribed in a record of purchase, folio 7v. Me῾oded ben Avraham and Sa῾id ben Saliman Al-Tawili: inscribed in a note of sale, folio 211v. Yosef ben Shemaryah: inscribed, folio 211v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Maimonides' Commentary on the Mishnah of Seder Nashim, in Judeo-Arabic.

msItem.title: Perush Seder nashim פרוש סדר נשים

collation.p: 21 quires: ii-xx10 (folios 12-200); xxi7 (201-208). Folios 1-11 and 209-211 contain various fragments, partly belonging to the original manuscript, and supply a deficiency in the text. Quires signed with Hebrew letters and Arabic numerals at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite semi-cursive script of the 15th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Maimonides' Commentary Seder Nashim. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2392.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 23 July 1881: inscribed, [212v].
